items.title: Bushfires leave trail of destruction in northern Victoria town
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Alex Carey comforts daughter, top scores for Adelaide Strikers in BBL return loss to Perth Scorchers
items.summary: After a sensational Ashes series, Alex Carey returns to Adelaide and the Big Bash with a bang, although it was a tougher night out for his daughter, Clementine.

items.title: WA health report card exposes where the state is struggling most
items.summary: The latest WA Health and Wellbeing report reveals how regions stack up when it comes to things like diet, smoking, exercise and mental health.

items.title: 'Extraordinary' number of clutches
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: High hopes for endangered white-throated snapping turtle after record number of clutches
items.summary: A record number of clutches of white-throated snapping turtles have been found along the Burnett River in Queensland's Bundaberg region.

items.title: Man allegedly wearing a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi charged with offensive conduct
items.summary: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

items.title: National domestic violence commissioner, legal services say Katherine court unsafe for women
items.summary: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

items.title: National bulk-billing rates are increasing, according to Cleanbill report
items.summary: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

items.title: Flood emergency warning for Clermont in central Queensland as ex-Cyclone Koji moves inland
items.summary: Authorities have issued a Flood Emergency Warning for the central Queensland town of Clermont as large parts of the state are on flood watch in the wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

items.title: Fed chairman Jerome Powell facing criminal probe, ACCC set to sue Coles, Woolies for price gouging, ASX rises — as it happened
items.summary: US Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell confirms he is facing a Department of Justice investigation, while Australia's competition watchdog will use new powers to go after the big supermarkets, according to a report.

items.title: Australian Open: Iga Świątek plays down fitness concerns after Belinda Bencic loss in Poland's United Cup win
items.summary: After two losses at the United Cup over the weekend, world number two Iga Świątek insists "everything is fine" with her fitness in the lead-up to the Australian Open.

items.title: Summer festival-goers continue to abandon truckloads of camping gear
items.summary: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

items.title: Supporting your child when starting child care or kindy
items.summary: It's natural to feel nervous about transitioning your baby or child into early childhood education. Knowing some settling techniques, as well as what you can advocate for on behalf of your child, can help their transition.

items.title: Campus Life program helping young people with disabilities transition after school
items.summary: A Brisbane mum was worried about what her son would do after high school, so she created a transition program to help other neurodivergent young adults.

items.title: Victorian fires: Twelve major fires still burning as number of buildings destroyed climbs
items.summary: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares burnt. Look back at our live coverage.

items.title: The Sydney suburbs saying no to fast food giants in the name of 'heart and character'
items.summary: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

items.title: In a rare interview, the Taliban's chief spokesman exposes the gap between narrative and reality
items.summary: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

items.title: Muslim leader and wife allegedly abused, assaulted in Melbourne
items.summary: Police are investigating reports of an Islamic community leader being assaulted after he and his wife were forced off the road by a vehicle and racially abused in Dandenong South.

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka is the woman to beat at Australian Open, showing even more versatility to her game
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka has won yet another title on Australian soil, showing that the Australian Open is hers for the taking.

items.title: ABC Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport Survey: Results summary
items.summary: Here is a summary of the results from ABC Sport's inaugural Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport Survey, in partnership with Deakin University.

items.title: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths
items.summary: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

items.title: Thousands gather for Bondi vigil, youngest victim honoured in Waltzing Matilda tribute
items.summary: More than 2,000 people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victim at the Bondi Pavilion, marking the end of the Jewish period of mourning.

items.title: Nick McBride could get $100k in taxpayer funding for re-election campaign
items.summary: Independent MP Nick McBride, who is currently on home detention bail for the alleged assault of his wife, could receive around $100,000 in public funding to support his re-election campaign, according to the state's electoral commission.

items.title: Donald Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal' as US cuts off Venezuelan oil
items.summary: The US is enforcing a strict oil blockade on Venezuela, the communist country's main supplier of oil, as the Trump administration continues to push Latin American countries to align with it.

items.title: Weight loss drug Wegovy to be subsidised for Australians with severe obesity
items.summary: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

items.title: Joining the Michelin Guide would put Australian restaurants 'on the world map', Sydney chef says
items.summary: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

items.title: Harcourt's heart in ruins but community standing strong after bushfires hit regional Victoria
items.summary: In a region famed for its lush pastoral farmland, locals thought Harcourt was less likely to be hit than neighbouring bush towns Castlemaine and Barkers Creek.

items.title: In Minneapolis, the deadly ICE shooting has reopened old wounds
items.summary: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

items.title: Remote fire detection technology set to double across Tasmania after AI cameras spot hundreds of blazes
items.summary: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

items.title: Former UK ambassador Peter Mandelson says he did not know about Epstein abuse
items.summary: Peter Mandelson, who was fired as the UK's ambassador in Washington DC over his ties to the convicted sex offender, has apologised to victims of Jeffrey Epstein "for a system that refused to hear their voices".

items.title: One dead in Longwood fire as Victoria's bushfire emergency enters its sixth day
items.summary: On Sunday afternoon, emergency services discovered the body of a person in Central Victoria. The fatal turn comes as firefighters use favourable conditions to contain more than 20 blazes across the state, but emergency warnings remain in place for some areas.

items.title: Daniil Medvedev beats Brandon Nakashima to win Brisbane International men's final
items.summary: Daniil Medvedev enjoys Australian Open warm up with first Brisbane International crown.

items.title: Mackenzie Coupland, Pat Eddy win AusCycling road race national championships in Perth
items.summary: Under 23 neo-pro Mackenzie Coupland and unheralded rider Pat Eddy have stunned the elite peloton to claim brilliant victories in the AusCycling road nationals in Perth.

items.title: At least 500 killed in Iran protests as Trump weighs up intervention
items.summary: The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency says a further 10,600 people have been arrested as Iran's theocratic government attempts to crack down on the demonstrations.

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka wins second-straight Brisbane International women's final, beating Marta Kostyuk
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka has claimed her second-straight Brisbane International title, beating Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3.

items.title: Festival chair, board members quit after author's cancellation from Writers' Week
items.summary: The Adelaide Festival board's decision to cancel the appearance of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from this year's Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted further fallout, with several board members and the chair stepping down.

items.title: Fun2Learn childcare centre in Sydney's west shut by new regulator after decade of safety breaches
items.summary: Fun2Learn in Rosehill is the first centre to have its doors forcibly shut by the new child care regulator after it uncovered 41 breaches.

items.title: Winds push bushfire smoke north, triggering air quality and health warnings for Victoria and NSW
items.summary: Health experts and authorities are urging people living north of Victoria's bushfires to limit their time outdoors as a weather system pushes bushfire smoke across the state and into New South Wales.

items.title: Volunteer firefighter's Alexandra home burns while he battles Victorian bushfires
items.summary: CFA volunteer Michael Harper discovers through the truck radio while on shift that his home is under threat.

items.title: Police discover human remains near car in bushfire-ravaged area east of Seymour
items.summary: Victoria confirms its first fatality in the bushfire emergency ravaging the state, with police discovering human remains east of the town of Seymour.

items.title: Shaun Tan's Tales from Outer Suburbia, now adapted for TV, shows the magic of the everyday
items.summary: Writer Shaun Tan highlighted the magic and whimsy of everyday Australia in his book Tales from Outer Suburbia. He talks about finding inspiration in the mundane, and what it was like turning his tales into TV.

items.summary: Everywhere you look around the Irvines' farm near Alexandra are signs of the fire that surrounded their home and burnt right up to the front porch.

items.title: Iranian protesters chant anti-government messages as authorities signal intensifying crackdown
items.summary: Anti-government chants filled the streets of Iran's capital on Saturday night, as protesters pressed the biggest movement against the Islamic republic's rulers in more than three years.

items.title: Puppies of Muster Dogs champion find homes with next generation of farmers
items.summary: In small towns scattered around Australia, five kids have hit the jackpot. They've each been given a puppy from a champion muster dog.

items.title: Macclesfield beats FA Cup champion Crystal Palace 2-1 in major upset
items.summary: Non-league Macclesfield delivers one of the biggest upsets in FA Cup history by stunning defending champion Crystal Palace 2-1.

items.title: Bob Weir, founding member of American rock band the Grateful Dead, dies aged 78
items.summary: Bob Weir's death was announced on Saturday in a statement on his Instagram page.

items.title: Rodeo up-and-comers backed by veterans to make it on world stage
items.summary: WA's brightest cowboys and cowgirls are being flown across the world to learn from champions of the sport.

items.title: Regional healthcare disparities leaving lipoedema patients without adequate care
items.summary: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

items.title: Tennis racquet stringer numbers take a hit in Australia while tournaments grow
items.summary: Behind the scenes of the world's most elite tennis tournaments there is a team of people working on keeping the majors' racquets well strung.

items.title: Arsenal comes out in support of Kyra Cooney-Cross in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis
items.summary: Arsenal players and supporters pay emotional tributes to Matildas star Kyra Cooney-Cross following her return to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with cancer.

items.title: Floodwaters from Queensland bring life to remote NSW wetland
items.summary: In a remote and isolated part of NSW, nature is enjoying a deluge of water still around from floods in Queensland last year.

items.title: Can spin bowling survive in pace-obsessed Australia?
items.summary: After an Ashes series dominated by pace bowlers, what does the future hold for young spinners wanting to play Test cricket for Australia?

items.title: NSW community bands hit hard as association misses out on vital government funding
items.summary: Wollongong’s collective of brass and wind bands have been putting on a show for locals for almost a century, but it is one of dozens of community bands across the state that faces an uncertain future due to a recent loss of funding.

items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Catholic priest swaps sermons for rock 'n' roll guitar solos in the Australian outback
items.summary: An Indonesian priest brings a deep love of rock 'n' roll to his pastoral care in western NSW.

items.title: Endangered animal populations bounce back on Kangaroo Island thanks to predator-proof fence
items.summary: Five years after feral cats were removed from inside the Western River Refuge on Kangaroo Island, populations of endangered species have boomed.

items.title: From Madonna to Metallica, these are the big albums turning 40 this year
items.summary: Pop and MTV ruled supreme but 1986 was also a banner year for hip hop and metal.

items.title: Victorian fires: One killed in bushfire disaster in Victoria as hundreds of structures lost — as it happened
items.summary: Several fires have been downgraded to watch and act but authorities are still battling to control many of the blazes that have claimed one life and destroyed hundreds of structures.

items.title: Albanese and Allan unveil $19.5 million support package as crews take stock of Victorian fire devastation
items.summary: Anthony Albanese and Jacinta Allan announce a multi-million-dollar emergency relief package for those affected by Victoria's devastating bushfires, as authorities warn hundreds of structures have been lost.

items.title: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?
items.summary: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.
